Following are analysts' comments on his decision and its implications for Prime Minister David Cameron : LABOUR PARTY LEADER ED MILIBAND Labour has been saying for some months that there are real questions about Andy Coulson 's ability to do his job given the cloud of allegations hanging over him. We think he should have gone earlier. He has now done the right thing. I think there are questions about David Cameron 's judgement, about hanging on to him as long as he did. in no hurry to make presidential decision Mike Pence Will Not Run for President Indiana announced Thursday that he would not be a Republican candidate for president in 2012, but he left the door open to running for governor. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mr. Mike Pence wrote in a letter to supporters.`` We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012.''
